column4: Symbol or Identifier as used in code
Internal identifier - will have specifiers appended to generate the specific routine name
Precedence in expressions - higher number equals higher priority
Can the order of the operators be swapped?
If yes, both operands must be compatible (and will be extended if necessary)
The second parameter is optional. (No, or blank for other cases)
The first parameter must be a variable reference (i.e. no immediate/constant data). Result will be assigned to this variable.
The first parameter must be a 16 bit value.
The second parameter must be an immediate/constant value
The type of the result. 'Same' means the result will be the same type as the operators (extended if necessary)

column14: Denotes an error if this gets through to the code generator
Move data from one location to another
Store an immediate value into (eg) a variable
DEPRECATED: Used for a load+store where the primitive itself does the load or store (i.e. write immedate value to variable)
Conditional branch with a constant expression (immediate value)
Load data into registers (for a function call with params passed in registers)
